verses.roman:
devāpiḥ śāntanor bhrātā
maruś cekṣvāku-vaṁśa-jaḥ
kalāpa-grāma āsāte
mahā-yoga-balānvitau

synonyms: devāpiḥ—Devāpi; śāntanoḥ—of Mahārāja Śāntanu; bhrātā—the brother; maruḥ—Maru; ca—and; ikṣvāku-vaṁśa-jaḥ—born in the dynasty of Ikṣvāku; kalāpa-grāme—in the village Kalāpa; āsāte—the two of them are living; mahā—great; yoga-bala—with mystic power; anvitau—endowed.
translation: Devāpi, the brother of Mahārāja Śāntanu, and Maru, the descendant of Ikṣvāku, both possess great mystic strength and are living even now in the village of Kalāpa.
